TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NotifyHostEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Used to send data from the hosted InfoPath form template to the Web page.

remarks.para: If XML data is passed to the control using the NotifyHost(System.String) method of the object available in the namespace, it is not validated before it is sent. Use the event and a corresponding SubmitToHostAdapter data connection from the form to receive validated XML in the Web page.

example.para: In the following example, the control, XmlFormView1, is hosted in a custom Web page and contains a browser-enabled form template located on the same site. The event of the control is used to populate a control, TextBox1, in the custom Web page.
example.code: Imports Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.Server.Controls Protected Sub XmlFormView1_NotifyHost(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.Server.Controls.NotifyHostEventArgs) Handles XmlFormView1.NotifyHost TextBox1.Text = e.Notification.ToString() End Sub
example.para: The form code necessary to send a value from the main data source in the form, my:field2, to the hosting Web page uses the method of the object available in the namespace, in this case from a button in the form.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL3_5_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) Dim myNav As XPathNavigator = Me.MainDataSource.CreateNavigator() Me.NotifyHost(myNav.SelectSingleNode("/my:myFields/my:field2", Me.NamespaceManager).ToString()) End Sub
example.para: The form code necessary to send a value from the main data source in the form, my:field2, to the hosting Web page uses the method of the object available in the namespace, in this case from a button in the form.

In the following example, the control, XmlFormView1, is hosted in a custom Web page and contains a browser-enabled form template located on the same site. The event of the control is used to populate a control, TextBox1, in the custom Web page.
example.code: Imports Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.Server.Controls Protected Sub XmlFormView1_NotifyHost(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As Microsoft.Office.InfoPath.Server.Controls.NotifyHostEventArgs) Handles XmlFormView1.NotifyHost TextBox1.Text = e.Notification.ToString() End Sub
example.para: The form code necessary to send a value from the main data source in the form, my:field2, to the hosting Web page uses the XmlForm.NotifyHost(System.String) method of the object available in the namespace, in this case from a button in the form.
example.code: Public Sub CTRL3_5_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) Dim myNav As XPathNavigator = Me.MainDataSource.CreateNavigator() Me.NotifyHost(myNav.SelectSingleNode("/my:myFields/my:field2", Me.NamespaceManager).ToString()) End Sub
example.para: The form code necessary to send a value from the main data source in the form, my:field2, to the hosting Web page uses the XmlForm.NotifyHost(System.String) method of the object available in the namespace, in this case from a button in the form.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Notification As String
public: property System::String ^ Notification { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the string passed from the form to the Web page hosting the control.

remarks.para: The property will be empty unless a string is passed from the form using the XmlForm.NotifyHost(System.String) method of the object, available in the namespace. For more information about this and other members of the namespace, see the Help installed with Visual Studio 2012.
